keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted police that he was armed and planned to 'shoot it up.'
Cagle was not armed at the time of arrest but police found an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle parked outside the airport.

He faces multiple charges including terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assaults, possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Cagle previously was convicted of marijuana possession over 20 years ago, indicating a prior legal history.
The incident occurred at the world’s busiest airport, which handles over 108 million passengers annually and is a critical global transportation hub.
Atlanta Mayor Andre Dickens noted that Cagle was mentally challenged and had a semi-automatic weapon, emphasizing the dangerous combination of mental health and weapon possession.
The FBI is assisting in the investigation, underscoring the national significance and severity of the threat.
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem praised the law enforcement response as a success in preventing a tragedy.
Cagle’s family alerted Cartersville police, who notified Atlanta Police, demonstrating the role of community vigilance in crisis prevention.
The arrest occurred at the airport’s south terminal, where surveillance showed Cagle was drawn to the heavily crowded TSA check-in area.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, the world’s busiest airport, after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up.' Though not armed at the time of arrest, police discovered an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle. Cagle, who previously was convicted of marijuana possession over 20 years ago, faces multiple felony charges, including terroristic threats and firearm possession. Authorities say he had arrived at the airport shortly before 9:30 a.m. and was observed near the heavily crowded TSA check-in area. His family’s early warning prompted Cartersville police to notify Atlanta Police, leading to a swift response. The FBI is assisting in the investigation, and officials, including Atlanta Mayor Andre Dickens and Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, have praised the success of law enforcement in averting a potential tragedy. This incident underscores the importance of community vigilance, mental health awareness, and airport security in preventing mass threats.
title: Man Arrested Inside Atlanta Airport After Making Threats to 'Shoot It Up'
